intro: Metrosideros polymorpha var. tremuloides, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame tree or red hibiscus, is a variant of the native Hawaiian tree known for its striking red flowers. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. This plant is typically found in coastal areas and lowland forests of Hawaii, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated by native birds and insects. The plant is also valued for its ornamental beauty and historical significance in Hawaiian culture.
